plantation_method.title: Oaks of Sikkim
data: 1. Taxonomic description of various species of oaks in the oak/Fagaceae family.
2. Include whole trees, leaf, acorns, flowers other identification keys as line drawings or images for identification by field people.
3. Prioritisation species based on their overall distribution, rarity, threat category across elevation ranges
4. Phenological stages/calendar as a table with proper illustrations focusing and planning on fruiting.

plantation_method.title: Background of oak forest regeneration in Sikkim
data: 1. Describe the previous work done on oak forest regeneration/restoration

plantation_method.title: Rationale for oak regeneration in Sikkim
data: 1. Description on importance of oak forests for Sikkim in terms of biodiversity, ecosystem services values, as a climax species and carbon sequestration function

plantation_method.title: Objectives: overall and specific
data: 1. What is our overll goal for oak forest restoration (long-term-10-20 years)-statements
2. What are some outputs we hope to achieve (short-term 5-10 years)-statements

plantation_method.title: Who is the manual for/targeted at?
data: 1. Brief description on who will use the manual.

plantation_method.title: Prioritisation of oak species
data: 1. Description which species of oaks to be targetted for restoration
2. Species prioritisation based on Rare, Endangered and Threatened species as well as those with potential of regeneration/restoration (early results)
3. Identification of associated species and ensuring 10% of associated species to be planted

plantation_method.title: Identification and selection of mother trees
data: 1. Description on what kind of trees to identify, mark and select for collection seeds
2. Based on morphological/phenotypic characters (age, canopy, trunk structure etc)

plantation_method.title: Acorn (seed) collection
data: 1. Description on different ways of collection: a) manually (from the tree); b) using agronet below the tree and shaking branches for seeds to drop; c) clearing the ground below the crown

plantation_method.title: Reduction of bulk - separation of seed from acorn
data: 1. Description on separation of seed from acorn

plantation_method.title: Seed segregation
data: 1. Description on selection through water floatation method
2. Description on manual selection through observation
3. Standards: Using weight of 1000 species≈1 Kg.

plantation_method.title: Seed drying
data: 1. Description of sun drying (not more than 2-3 days) on bamboo sheets.
2. Description of shade drying

plantation_method.title: Seed sowing / dibbling
data: 1. Description of dibbling in roasted (sterlilzed) sand
2. Description on sowing directly on raised beds / racks, using different modes of seed orientation (upside/vertical, slanting)

plantation_method.title: Regular watering / misting
data: 1. Describtion of watering. Alternate days depending on weather and soil conditions

plantation_method.title: Seed Culling
data: 1. Description on sorting or removal of imprefectly germinated seeds and seedlings.
2. Description on the criteria for removal/culling

plantation_method.title: Preperation of pricking out beds
data: 1. Description of Raised beds (racks), filling of root trainers( 500 cc / 12 hole) (with 25% sand, 50% jungle manure and 25% compost/cow dung)

plantation_method.title: Seedling maintainance
data: 1. Description Weeding, watering (as per requirement) in polyhouse / under agro-net whatever be the condition

plantation_method.title: Weathering (hardening process)
data: 1. Description on the process by bringing them out in agronet shade and in the open before planting in the plantation for acclimatization and adaptation

plantation_method.title: Selection of plantation sites
data: 1. Description on selection of plantation sites based on :altitude, aspect, slope (below 45 deg, or with terracing), forest type, surrounding habitat conditions, drainage, carrying capacity of the site, threats & distrubances (grazing, proximity to villages, roads etc).
2. Description on selecting open & degraded forest types.
3. Description on the habitat suitability of prioritised species

plantation_method.title: Preperation of planting sites
data: 1. Description on cutting, cleaning  of unwanted species (Jan-march)

plantation_method.title: Laying of plantation sites
data: 1. Description of staking, with a 1m long stick/bamboo at the spacing of 3m x 3m (May)

plantation_method.title: Pit preperation
data: 1. Description of planting pit digging (45 cm x 45 cm x 45cm size). Leave for weathering for atleast 1 week.
2. Description on the placement of the dug up soil  on the uphill side of the pit (May).

plantation_method.title: Selection of seedlings & transportation
data: 1. Description on selection of seedlings (criteira seedlings that are 2-3 years old and 2 feet tall).
2. Description of seedling handling, during transportation  (by vehicle, head load)

plantation_method.title: Planting of seedlings
data: 1. Description of placing the seedling in the dug pit and fixing of sticks (staking) to the seedling using local climbers or grass.

2. Description of proper fixing of seedline to the soil: While planting, soil level should be upto the root collar, should not allow for water logging. Soil should be packed well at the collar(mid-June).

monitoring_protocol.title: All the physical characteristics: location, elevation, aspect, slope, area, canopy cover
Grazing, trampling, anthropogenic activities, storms and tree/branches fall, landslides, water logging etc
